title: ISic002907. Fragmentary dedication to the Diva Poppaea
body:
1[Divae] Ạugu[s]tae
2[Popp]ạeaẹ
3[Neroni Cl]aud[io]
4[Caesari A]ugu[sto]
5[Germ]ạnic[o]
6[p(ontifici) m(aximo) tr(ibunicia) pot(estate) .. imp(eratori)] · co(n)s(uli) [p(ater) p(atriae)]
7[--- f(ilius) H]onorạ[tus]
8[sacerdos Augusti] a · po[pulo]
9[--- qui dedic]atio[ne epu-]
10[lum sing(ulis) decurioni]bus · [x---]
11[sexviris X--- populo X]ỊS · et [gladia-]
12[torum paria? --- d]edit [---]
13[templum? terrae m]otibu[s conla-]
14[psum sua? pecunia? restituit?]

1[.....].UGU[.]TAE
2[....].EA.
3[........]AUD[..]
4[........]UGU[...]
5[....].NIC[.]
6[...........··....]·COS[....]
7[---...]ONOR.[...]
8[...............]A·PO[....]
9[---........]ATIO[.....]
10[.................]BUS·[.---]
11[.........---.......].S·ET[......]
12[..........---.]EDIT[---]
13[..............]OTIBU[......]
14[.......................]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • The text follows the edition proposed in Manganaro 1982, p. 500, which was itself derived from a proposal of Degrassi (so Manganaro 2005: 186 no.2), with the only modification being the expansion of the abbreviation sing. However, it is worth noting that the same publication includes a handwritten sketch of the inscription (fig. 4, p. 498), which suggests some alternative readings: the numeral restored at the end of line 10 is XIIIS, not X[-]; in line 11, the numeral following sexviris is restored as XIII, not X[-]; and in line 12, the restoration amplius is proposed at the end of the line instead of leaving a gap.

translation

commentary

bibliography

  • Gentili NSA 1950 303, 315 fig.16 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
  • Pace 1951 459 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001689
  • Gentili 1952 44 n.7 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001434
  • Manganaro 1982 500 no.2 figs.3-4 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001835
  • Wilson 1983 93 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002650
  • Manganaro 1988 25, 29 n.123 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001427
  • Manganaro 2005 186 no.2 fig.16-17 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001800
